titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Arna Bontemps Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Arna Bontemps Collections contains writings and correspondence presented to the James Weldon Johnson Collection by Mr. Bontemps.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Arna Bontemps Collection contains items presented to the James Weldon Johnson Collection by Mr. Bontemps.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Arna Bontemps Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Arna Bontemps Collection. James Weldon Johnson Collection in the Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing manuscripts inventory. All pertinent information has been retained.

bioghist.head: ARNA BONTEMPS (1902-1973)
bioghist.p: Arna Bontemps was a teacher and writer whose novel God Sends Sunday appeared at the end of the Harlem Renaissance in 1931. He continued writing and editing anthologies and served as librarian at Fisk University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
The papers contains materials documenting the life of Arna Bontemps, including Series I, Correspondence
, and Series II, Writings
.

did.unittitle: Research notes, clippings, and typed manuscript of biographical sketch of Dean Dixon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: biographical sketches of Benjamin Davis, E. Simms Campbell, Mildred E. Blount, Emmett M. May, Algernon R. Henry, Hazel Scott, Mildred Blount, Dean Dixon, Benjamin Davis, Horace Cayton and Revels Cayton, Jimmy LuValle, Douglas Watson, Sylvestre C. Watkins, and Beatrice Johnson Trammell.
